Function reference

Polars-specific functions

Functionalities from Polars

as_polars()
Convert an R dataframe to a Polars Data/LazyFrame
describe()
Summary statistics for a Polars DataFrame
describe_plan() describe_optimized_plan()
Show the optimized and non-optimized query plans
fetch()
Fetch n rows of a LazyFrame
make_unique_id()
Create a column with unique id per row values
sink_csv()
Stream output to a CSV file
sink_parquet()
Stream output to a parquet file
to_r()
Convert a Polars DataFrame to an R data.frame

From dplyr

Functions coming from dplyr

pl_count() pl_add_count()
Count the observations in each group
pl_semi_join() pl_anti_join()
Filtering joins
pl_arrange()
Order rows using column values
pl_bind_cols()
Append multiple Data/LazyFrames next to each other
pl_bind_rows()
Stack multiple Data/LazyFrames on top of each other
pl_collect()
Collect a LazyFrame
pl_cross_join()
Cross join
pl_distinct() duplicated_rows()
Remove or keep only duplicated rows in a Data/LazyFrame
pl_filter()
Keep rows that match a condition
pl_left_join() pl_right_join() pl_full_join() pl_inner_join()
Mutating joins
pl_group_by() pl_ungroup()
Group by one or more variables
pl_mutate()
Create, modify, and delete columns
pl_pull()
Extract a variable of a Data/LazyFrame
pl_relocate()
Change column order
pl_rename() pl_rename_with()
Rename columns
pl_select()
Select columns from a Data/LazyFrame
pl_separate()
Separate a character column into multiple columns based on a substring
pl_slice_tail() pl_slice_head() pl_slice_sample()
Subset rows of a Data/LazyFrame
pl_summarize() pl_summarise()
Summarize each group down to one row

From tidyr

Functions coming from tidyr

pl_complete()
Complete a data frame with missing combinations of data
pl_drop_na()
Drop missing values
pl_fill()
Fill in missing values with previous or next value
pl_pivot_longer()
Pivot Data/LazyFrame from wide to long
pl_pivot_wider()
Pivot Data/LazyFrame from long to wide
pl_replace_na()
Replace NAs with specified values
pl_separate()
Separate a character column into multiple columns based on a substring
pl_unite()
Unite multiple columns into one by pasting strings together

Datasets

Datasets reexported from various tidyverse packages

fish_encounters
Fish encounters
relig_income
Pew religion and income survey
